findings.title: Insufficient require checks on the createPool parameters
findings.description: The parameters tokenPerShareMultiplier, cycleDuration, startOfDeposit and tokenPerShare in the constructor and createPool() function do not have any required checks on their range of values allowed and thus, can be exploited by the owner.

findings.title: For loop over dynamic array leads to out of gas
findings.description: There is a for loop used over dynamic array _initialPools in the constructor.

findings.title: Staking Token is assumed to be non-malicious
findings.description: The staking token MGH token which is a MiniMeToken is assumed to be non-malicious without sufficient proof.

findings.title: Insufficient require checks on cycletoken in updatePool()
findings.description: The function updatePool() lacks sufficient require checks on the cycletoken variable.

findings.title: Insufficient liquidity in the Staking Pool
findings.description: The staking pool may not have sufficient tokens to fulfill user withdrawals, leading to potential losses.

findings.title: Missing error messages
findings.description: There is missing error message in the require statement on lines: 51 and 62

findings.title: Missing zero address check
findings.description: The contract does not check if an address is zero before performing operations.

findings.title: Insufficient Documentation Provided
findings.description: The audit report highlights the need for sufficient documentation to ensure clarity and understanding of the smart contract's functionality.

findings.title: Unused Function Parameter
findings.description: There is an unused function parameter _stakeToken in the receiveApproval() function.
